Comment.MultiLanguageText: LOOP ADAPT TO NEW MANUAL VALUE=1

AttributeList.Text:
****** PARAMETER DESCRIPTION :
AUTOMATIC CONTROLLER CALCULATES ACCORDING TO THE P, I AND D PARAMETERS. MANUAL THIS BIT OVERRIDES THE AUTOMATIC FLAG AND SETS THE CONTROLLER INTO MANUAL MODE. THE LOOP THEN ADAPTS THE INTERNAL INTEGRAL REGISTERS TO THE MANUAL VALUE ENTERED IN THE "OP" CELL. ADAPT WHEN SETTING THIS SIGNAL, THE LOOP ADAPTS THE INTERNAL REGISTERS. SIGNAL IS RESET AUTOMATICLY AND OPERATION CONTINUES IN PREVIUS MODE. DIRECT REGULATOR MODE; WHEN TRUE IS ENTERED THE FUNCTION BLOCK CALCULATES THE PID ALGORITHM AS AN INVERTED CONTROLLER. PV CELLADDRESS FOR PROCESS VALUE. SP CELLADDRESS FOR SETPOINT VALUE. FF CELLADDRESS FOR FEED FORWARD VALUE. THE VALUE SUPPLIED TO THIS ADDRESS, IS ADDED TO THE OUTPUT AFTER THE CALCULATED PID OUTPUT. RANGERESTRICTIONS : (0.0-1.0) => MINIMUM TO MAXIMUM LOOP OUTPUT. PV_MAX, MAXIMUM AND MINIMUM RANGE OF PROCESSVALUE AND LOOP OUTPUT IN OP_MAX, ENGINEERING UNITS OP_MIN P,I,D CELLADDRESS OF THE PARAMETERS P,I,D. P AS GAIN FACTOR. I AND D AS INTEGRAL AND DERIVATIVE TIME IN SECONDS. ScanTime The interrupt time for the call, normally 0.01 if called from OB35 where interrupt time is 100mS OP CELLADDRESS FOR OUTPUT VALUE, INTEGER intgr,diff, CELLADDRESS FOR INTERNAL REGISTER USED BY PID FUNCTION AS ndev_1 INTEGRAL/DERIVATION REGISTERS.
****** REVISION HISTORY :
VERSION DATE BY DESCRIPTION
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1.00 9/1-97 FMJ FUNCTION CREATED 1.01 22/1/97 OA OUTPUT VALUE (OP) AND SETPOINT (SP) CONVERTED TO BE AN INTEGER 1.02 25/1/99 OA Errorhandling antifreeze implemented 1.03 09/04/99 HTO Integral register underflow corrected, SAVE section corrected, both caused reg. to lock up.
****** CALLING SYNTAX :
CALL FC 3 AUTOMATIC:=M0.0 // AUTOMATIC FLAG, REGULATOR STARTS MANUAL :=M0.1 // MANUAL FLAG OVERRIDES AUTOMATIC MODE ADAPT :=FALSE // LOOP ADAPTION NOT USED DIRECT :=FALSE // FIXED WARM REGULATOR PV :=DB15.DBD0 // PROCESS VALUE, REAL VALUE SP :=DB15.DBD0 // SETPOINT VALUE, INTEGER VALUE FF :=0.000000e+000 // FEEDFORWARD NOT USED PV_MAX :=1.000000e+002 // PROCESS-, SETPOINT- RANGE IS 0.0-100 F.EX PV_MIN :=0.000000e+000 OP_MAX :=1.000000e+002 // OUTPUT RANG IS 0.0-100.0 OR 2000 TO 400 mA" OP_MIN :=0.000000e+000 P :=DB15.DBD8 // GAIN REGISTER I :=DB15.DBD12 // INTEGRAL TIME D :=DB15.DBD16 // DERIVATIVE TIME ScanTime :=0.01 // Scan Time OP :=DB15.DBW8 // LOOP OUTPUT intgr :=DB15.DBD20 // ! diff :=DB15.DBD24 // ! INTERNAL REGISTERS ndev_1 :=DB15.DBD28 // !
Reset all internal registers in off state. Supply minimum outputvalue to output. INITIALIZE ALL VARIABLES WHEN CONTROLLER IS OFF
Convert processvalue to normalized value according to following formular : PVnorm = (PV - PV_MIN) / (PV_MAX - PV_MIN) PROCESS VALUE CONVERTION
CONVERT INPUT VALUES TO NORMALIZED VALUES

LineComment.Text: TO AVOID DIVISION BY ZERO ERROR
DIVIDE GAIN PART BY INTEGRATION TIME
CHECK IF DERIVATIVE TIME IS ZERO
THIS AND PREVIUS SCAN AND MULTIPLY BY
ONLY INTEGRATE AS LONG AS OUTPUT WITHIN
CONVERT OUTPUT FROM NORMALIZED VALUE TO ENGINEERING VALUE
IN CASE OF OVEFLOW IN INTEGRAL REGISTER
IN CASE OF UNDERFLOW IN INTEGRAL REGISTER
MAKE ONESHOT TO UPDATE THE INTEGRAL REGISTER
SET CURRENT OUTPUT INTO INTEGRATION CELL
